intro: Acourtia intermedia, commonly known as the slender acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, yellowish to white flowers that bloom in the spring. Acourtia intermedia is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
